prompt: As a user, I want to write a ‘about you’ page so that others can learn about me. That is,I fill in some predefined field and also have a free-text field or two.
completion: As a site member, I want to describe myself on my own page in a semi-structured way so that others can learn about me. That is, I can fill in predefined fields, but also have room for a free-text field or two. (It would be nice to let this free text be HTML or similar.) ###

prompt: As a site user,  I want to apply to become a Certified Scrum Practitioner so that I can earn that certification.
completion: As a site member, I can fill out an application to become a Certified Scrum Practitioner so that I can earn that designation. [Note: Certified Scrum Practitioner was the initial name of what became known as Certified Scrum Professional.] ###

prompt: As a Certified Scrum Practitioner, I want my ‘about you’ page to include additional details about me (i.e., some of the answers to my Practitioner application) so that I can show my experience.
completion: As a Practitioner, I want my profile page to include additional details about me (i.e., some of the answers to my Practitioner application) so that I can showcase my experience. ###

prompt: As a site member, I want to teach CSM and CSPO courses and certify others. I can fill out applications to become a Certified Scrum Trainer so that I can teach and certify others.
completion: As a site member, I can fill out an application to become a Certified Scrum Trainer so that I can teach CSM and CSPO courses and certify others. ###

prompt: As a Trainer, I want my ‘about me’ page to include additional data so that others can learn about me and decide if I’m the best trainer of all to help them.
completion: As a Trainer, I want my profile page to include additional details about me (i.e., some of the answers to my Trainer application) so that others can learn about me and decide if I’m the right trainer for them.###

prompt: As a Practitioner or Trainer, both typer of users. when I write an article for the site I want a small graphic shown with the article showing my CSP or CST status so that others know my certifications when reading and can know more about my certifications.
completion: As a Practitioner or Trainer, when I write an article for the site I want a small graphic shown with the article showing my CSP or CST status so that others know my certifications when reading. (For example, Amazon’s “Top 500 Reviewers” approach.)###

prompt: As a trainer, I want my profile to present a  list  my upcoming classes and a link to a page about each so that attendees can find my courses and classes.
completion: As a trainer, I want my profile to list my upcoming classes and include a link to a detailed page about each so that prospective attendees can find my courses. ###

prompt: As a site member, I want to view the other members profiles so that I can find other members I might want to connect to me.
completion: As a site member, I can view the profiles of other members so that I can find others I might want to connect with. ###

prompt: As a user, I want to  find others I might want to connect with I can search for profiles based on a few fields as class attended, location, name so I can find them.
completion: As a site member, I can search for profiles based on a few fields (class attended, location, name) so I can find others I might want to connect with. ###

prompt: As a member, I want only my name will appear so that no one can learn things about me that I don’t want shared. So I want have my profile as private.
completion: As a site member, I can mark my profile as private in which case only my name will appear so that no one can learn things about me I don’t want shared. ###

prompt: As a user that is a site member, I want to have the option for my email address to be as private so that no one can contact me via email  even if the rest of my profile is not private.
completion: As a site member, I can mark my email address as private even if the rest of my profile is not so that no one can contact me.###

prompt: send emails to members via a form so that we can connect on the site.
completion: As a site member, I can send an email to any member via a form so that we can connect. ###

prompt: I want to read practicing and training applications and approve them so that only applicants who qualify can become CSPs or CSTs can be done. This should be aprovied or denied by me as a administrator.
completion: As a site administrator, I can read practicing and training applications and approve or reject them so that only applicants who qualify can become CSPs or CSTs###

prompt: As admin, I want to be able to edit members profile so that I can correct problems that the members might have.
completion: As a site administrator, I can edit any site member profile so that I can correct problems for members.  ###

prompt: dont have an account and access the site so I can read news on the home page so that I stay updated with agile news.
completion: As a site visitor, I can read current news on the home page so that I stay current on agile news###

prompt: As a site visitor, I access old news that is no longer on the home page, so I can access things I remember from the past.
completion: As a site visitor, I can access old news that is no longer on the home page, so I can access things I remember from the past or that others mention to me. ###

prompt: As a visitor user, I want to email news items to the editor  (Note: this could just be an email link to the editor.), so they can be considered for publication. Even when i don't have an account and am just a visitor.
completion: As a site visitor, I can email news items to the editor, so they can be considered for publication. (Note: this could just be an email link to the editor.) ###

prompt: As a site a site editor, so articles are published on and through appropriate dates I set the following dates on a news item: Start Publishing Date, Old News Date, Stop Publishing Date.These dates refer to the date an item is published and gets removed. posts might never be deleted.
completion: As a site editor, I can set the following dates on a news item: Start Publishing Date, Old News Date, Stop Publishing Date so articles are published on and through appropriate dates. These dates refer to the date an item becomes visible on the site (perhaps next Monday), the date it stops appearing on the home page, and the date it is removed from the site (which may be never). ###

prompt: As a member, to remain sufficiently and easily informed I subscribe to an RSS feed of news and events. To keep up with the feed and news. So I subscribe to it.
completion: As a site member, I can subscribe to an RSS feed of news (and events?) so I remain sufficiently and easily informed. ###

prompt: Items are displayed on the front page based on priority. Me as an editor, I assign priority numbers to news items, so I can indicate which articles I want featured most prominently on the site.
completion: As a site editor, I can assign priority numbers to news items, so I can indicate which articles I want featured most prominently on the site. Note: Items are displayed on the front page based on priority.###

prompt: I want to see a list of all upcoming “Certification Courses” and navigate through pages them, so I can choose the best course for me.
completion: As a site visitor, I can see a list of all upcoming “Certification Courses” and can page through them if there are a lot, so I can choose the best course for me. ###

prompt: to choose a course I want to see a list of all upcoming non-certification courses, page through them if necessary.
completion: As a site visitor, I can see a list of all upcoming “Other Courses” (non-certification courses) and can page through them if necessary, so I can choose the best course for me.###

prompt: I want to attend any“Events”.
completion: As a site visitor, I can see a list of all upcoming “Events” so I can decide if I want to attend any. (Events are things such as the Scrum Gathering, conferences, free seminars, etc.) ###

prompt: trainer, I wanna create a new course or event, so site visitors can see it. It should have some predefined fields like name, description, start and end date and register button.
completion: As a trainer, I can create a new course or event, so site visitors can see it. Note: This includes the following information: name, description (HTML), trainer names (multiple selection from a list), start date, end date, venue name (HTML) and address, contact name, contact phone, contact email, a link for more information, and a link to register. For a certification course the name of the class is a dropdown list; for others, it is free text. ###

prompt: When a treiner create an Course or Event they should be charged a fee for that activity so they don’t list events they don’t really intend to execute or participate
completion: As a trainer, when I create an Other Course or Event, I am charged a listing fee for that activity so I don’t list events I don’t really intend to hold. ###

prompt: As a admin, I can create an course or event that is not charged a listing fee.
completion: As a site administrator, I can create an Other Course (?) or Event that is not charged a listing fee. This is so that the Scrum Alliance doesn’t charge itself for Scrum Gatherings that it puts on. ###

prompt: The admins  can set the listing fee per to course or event so that we have flexibility on what to charge in the future.
completion: As a site administrator, I can set the listing fee per Other Course or Event so that we have flexibility on what (if anything) to charge in the future. ###

prompt: The trainee should be able to update one of my existing courses or events so it has accurate information.
completion: As a trainer, I can update one of my existing courses or events so that it reflects accurate information###

prompt: When the trainee delete their courses or events, it’s no longer listed if they cancel for some reason
completion: As a trainer, I can delete one of my courses or events, so it’s no longer listed if I cancel for some reason###

prompt: The trainer can copy one of their courses or events so that they could can create a new one. When copying it I am asked for the date of the new course or event.
completion: As a trainer, I can copy one of my courses or events so that I can create a new one. When copying it I am asked for the date(s) of the new course or event. ###

prompt: Admins should be able to delete any course or event, they can remove things that will no longer occur. For any reason, at any place and at any moment.
completion: As a site admin, I can delete any course or event, so I can remove things that will no longer occur.  ###

prompt: Editors should be able update any course or event so that they can fix things the original author hasn’t corrected.
completion: As a site editor, I can update any course or event so that I can fix things the original author hasn’t.  ###

prompt: The users, that are: trainer, admin, or editor,  should bne able to turn a course into an event or an event into a course.
completion: As a trainer, admin, or editor, I can turn a course into an event or an event into a course, so I can correctly classify anything that was entered incorrectly###

prompt: An search option that is advanced for me to fill in a form of search by country, state, trainer name, date range, word in description, etc. so I can quickly find what I’m looking for.
completion: As a site visitor, I have an advanced search option that lets me fill in a form of search criteria (country, state, trainer name, date range, word in description, etc.) so I can quickly find what I’m looking for. ###

prompt: when viewing a course I click on the trainer’s name and go to the trainer’s profile, so I can read more about a trainer and see their data.
completion: As a site visitor, when I’m viewing a course I can click on the trainer’s name and be taken to the trainer’s profile, so I can read more about a trainer before registering for a course###

prompt: I subscribe to an RSS feed of upcoming courses and events and I’m up to date without having to visit the site
completion: As a site visitor, I can subscribe to an RSS feed of upcoming courses and events so that I’m up to day without having to visit the site. ###

prompt: read quick answers
completion: As a site visitor, I can read FAQs, so I can get quick answers###

prompt: The site editor will write frequently asked questions answers in a section to help the support team get fewer dumb and easily answered questions
completion: As a site editor, I can maintain a FAQ section so that support gets fewer easily answered questions###

prompt: I do  full-text search of the FAQs, and I find answer quickly. When FAQs are more than one page
completion: As a site visitor, I can do a full-text search of the FAQs, so I can find an answer quickly. (Note: Only needed if FAQs are more than one page.) ###

prompt: member can download the latest training material and methodology PDFs to have them in their computerr.
completion: As a site member, I can download the latest training material and methodology PDFs so I have them###

prompt: I download presentations & PDFs
completion: • As a visitor, I can download presentations, PDFs, etc. on Scrum so that I can learn from them or use them###

prompt: Site, please let me scroll through jobs
completion: As a site member (?), I can scroll through a listing of jobs, so I can see if there any I’m interested in. (There won’t be enough at first to justify search fields.)###

prompt: I post a ad so that I can attract candidates i  wants to hire
completion: As someone who wants to hire, I can post a help wanted ad so that I can attract candidates.###

prompt: Note: May not be needed long term. approve ad before it goes to the site.
completion: As a site admin, I need to approve each help wanted ad before it gets to the site so that we’re sure of the quality of jobs being listed. Note: May not be needed long term###

prompt: Email me  whenever a job is submitted so i decide if I want to post it or not. Just the administrator should be doing this.
completion: As a site admin, I am emailed whenever a job is submitted so that I am aware of it and can decide if I want to post it###

prompt: User wants to see all of the jobs availableand  read them without visiting the site so they subscribe
completion: As a site member, I can subscribe to an RSS feed of jobs available so that I can read them without visiting the site###

prompt: Admin can edit and delete ads that help to correct problems and check the ads is acurrete with the site guidelines.
completion: As a site admin, I can edit and delete help wanted ads so I can correct small problems or make sure each ad complies with site guidelines.###
